Current News

View All

  1. City of Durham Status Report Regarding 115 North Duke Street Explosion

    Additional Info...

  2. Support Providers Ready to Help Durham Businesses Impacted by Gas Explosion

    Small Business Advisory Committee and NCWorks Hosting Events at Downtown’s Chesterfield Building Additional Info...

  3. Resident's Encouraged to "Go Green" at Durham's Earth Day Festival

    Durham residents will receive information on the many ways to “love” the Earth and make a local impact at Durham’s 2019 Earth Day Festival on Sunday, April 28 from 12 p.m. – 5 p.m. at Durham Central Park on 501 Foster Street. Additional Info...

  4. Downtown Durham Explosion

    An explosion happened shortly after 10 a.m. today in downtown Durham. One person has been confirmed dead and 15 other people have been taken to local hospitals. Further details will be released at a 2 p.m. press conference at Duke St.and Fernway Ave. Additional Info...

  5. Durham Seeks More Input on Zoning Changes to Expand Housing Choices

    This Saturday, April 27 meeting is an opportunity for residents and property owners to learn about the Expanding Housing Choices Initiative, which is designed to allow for more and varied housing options. Additional Info...

  6. Durham Seeks User Feedback on Website Design

    When you visit the City of Durham website, what drives you nuts? What works well? Now’s your chance to tell us. Take the online survey now through April 30. Additional Info...

  7. Most City of Durham Offices Closed for Good Friday

    Residents Asked to Note Changes in City-Provided Services & Programs Additional Info...

  8. Durham Joins 8th Annual Mayor’s Challenge for Water Conservation

    April is Earth Month, and water is our planet’s most precious natural resource. Throughout April, Durham residents are invited to join Mayor Steve Schewel and help the City win the National Mayor’s Challenge for Water Conservation. Additional Info...

  9. Watch City Life: Celebrating Durham’s 150th Anniversary

    2019 is a big year for Durham - in April we celebrate the city's 150th anniversary. In this episode, find out how the Bull City is marking this milestone and how everyone can get involved. Read on...

  10. Durham Seeks Resident Input on Food Waste and Composting

    Online Survey Available Until May 31 in English and Spanish Additional Info...

  11. Durham Seeks Applicants for Building Improvement Grants

    April 18 Deadline to Submit Applications; Public Information Session Set for March 19 Additional Info...

  12. Durham Police Summer Camps Offer Fun Inside, Out

    Application Deadline is May 3 Additional Info...
/CivicAlerts.aspx
